comment: One of the best professors that I've ever taken. There's good reason McElroy has had so much success in her career. She works hard, puts out good results and does it the right way. She once told our Reporting Words class that she's always put herself and her own first in her career, and I think that's amazing advice in this consuming field.
If you get her class and it has SI... GOOOO! Dont even go to class, just go to SI, youll get a 100 on every test!
She is AWESOME! It is true she does show movies and clips but they are relevant to the lecture. You can earn easy extra credit if you show up, and SI helps a great deal with reinforcing the lecture.

Her classes and presentation are very boring and hard to follow. She's all over the place and gets kinda scattered. Honestly, if you just go to the SI sessions though you will easily get a B in the class and be able to work for an A if you study your SI notes.

Very poor teaching. I learned nothing during the lectures and they were quite boring. S.I. Sessions are the only way to know what will be on the test. She shows a lot of pointless videos and pictures instead of stuff pertaining to the subject. Also not helpful at all. She never once answered a question I asked. I strongly recommend someone else.

Dr. McElroy is pretty okay. She is really knowledgeable about her field. But her lectures are really boring. There are no notes on the slides. Just a bunch of pictures. Go to the SI sessions and that's where you'll actually learn whats on the tests. She does give an extreme amount of extra credit to those who show up to class. Go to SI and get an A

Mrs. McElroy is actually a really good professor. Class is not mandatory, however she gives copious amount of extra credit for those who come to class. She was really nice and extremely helpful. If you attend SI sessions along with going to class, you should not have a problem getting an A. Just do the labs & the mastering.

Mixed feelings about this teacher. Her lectures can get a little scattered, she goes off topic a lot...but if you go to class consistently and go to SI and pretty much just pay any attention, you'll do fine on the tests. It's not too hard to make a B, and you can work to get an A.

I seriously don't know why so many of these ratings are bad. Dr. McElroy is a great professor and interesting to listen to. Her tests are NOT HARD if you go to class, SI, and read the textbook. She is very fair and even offers a multitude of extra credit opportunities. 5 multiple choice tests, lowest is dropped--or take the first 4. Easy A.

This is a real college class. You must go to class, read the labs, and go to SI. The tests are short 40 questions max, but she gives a lot of extra credit (always in class). If you have a problem she is willing to help, but no special treatment. You get the grade you earn. I got an A. :-)

You MUST read the textbook and do all the online labs or you will have absolutely no idea what is going on. There are four tests and those are your only grades. She posts all the powerpoints online ahead of time. So it's almost pointless to go to class.

Worst Science professor Kennesaw State has! You have to read the text BEFORE coming to class to have ANY idea what she is talking about in her lectures. The four exams are RIDICULOUSLY hard and she does any and everything to make every question a trick question. Does not provide any other assignments for grades. DO NOT TAKE HER

People only hate her because they dont go to class. If you go to class and listen the class really is not bad at all. The tests are short and to the point. Not a bad class to take if you are not an idiot.

Do not take her class! She is all over the place in her lectures. She has tons of extra material in her power points that she will put in the test. The tests cover 2 chapters, power point lectures with pointless material, labs, and sometimes a short movie. The best part is she gives no study guide. I worked hard for a B. Find another teacher!
Not bad at all. Read the labs before the test and you'll do fine. She puts allot on the test from her lectures. So go to class it makes the tests easy.

I do not consider this teacher to be a good teacher at all. I asked questions in class and EVERY time she said "It's in your book". She is not helpful what so ever. Her class goes entirely off the book so i'm not sure why she's even there. I studied very hard and made a B+. The material is very cool though and interesting, she's just a bad teacher.

The material for this class is fascinating, and the professor is obviously knowledgeable. Her tests are horribly written, though, and your grade is based on 4 tests. I got a B and I studied hard for each test. She loses focus in class a lot and doesn't seem cut out to be a lecture professor at all.

Never went to class execpt on test days and on the first day of class. Did not do any labs. Didnt study except for the final. failed 2 tests and still got a C in the class. Go to class do extra credit oportunities and study and you will get a A. If you cant pass this class you are not very bright.

This is definitly not an EASY A but it is extremely possible for you to get an A.  Go to the SI sessions-they make all the difference in the world!  Do the labs, come to class...and you will get a B or an A easily. She also gives a lot of extra credit opportunities- DO THEM!

I was hoping Environmental Science would be an easy class, according to anyone I know who has taken it, it is. Somehow she makes this difficult. She rambles in class but you have to write everything down that she says because it is on the tests. If you want this class for an easy A, don't even think about taking it with her.

Pay attention and dont miss class. 1/2 of the classes are spent watching movies or videos and there are quite a few questions on the tests about the videos. DO THE LABS. You just have to read and calulate things such as how much pollution we put out each year, but they are all on the test.

Make sure you attent class everyday because most of her questions come from what she specifically talked about in class. Also make sure you attend S.I. sessions because that is your ONLY HOPE in passing. Also I hope you don't have ANY EMERGENCY WHATSOEVER because you are not allowed to make up tests but she does drop the lowest.don't take this clas

She's not as bad as everyone makes her out to be. She is kind of nutty, and she likes to go on about stories. Her notes are outlines for when you study but you pretty much have to read the book. Your final grade is based off of 4 exams. If you're willing to put in the effort, she's a great teacher. She also has a lot of extra credit opportunities.

She is a BAD teacher.  She's very interested in the topic but doesn't try to help you learn the material.  SI is practically mandatory to not fail, she just presents the info and expects you to understand it from all aspects and her questions come from left field.  Very unhelpful, DO NOT TAKER HER!

She is an okay teacher. She isn't as bad as most people ae saying AT ALL. Her lectures are interesting but they don't really help. Attend SI sessions and read the book and you will be fine. She also gives lots of extra credit which helps alot. She really isn't so bad. I would reccomend her if you are willing to put in the work and effort.

Worst teacher in the world! She does not help you at all! you have to do all the reading because she does not cover anything in class for the tests! She only shows pointless youtube videos in class! DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HER!
If you take notes and attend the student assistance classes you can make a good grade. Not a gimmee!

Exceptional professor with great energy.  She uses a wide variety of media for examples to the topic and works hard to make content relevant.  No study guide for tests, but if you've done the work and read the text they're a breeze.  Show up, stay awake, and do the work and you'll be fine.  You might even enjoy it!  (even those that hate science!)
Lecture mildy interesting, its a basic sci class nothing real entertaining. Take notes, DO YOUR LABS, and read your book prior to the test and you will be fine as long as your not brain dead.

DO NOT TAKE. class is very hard. attendance is not mandatory but she does go over the powerpoints in class. if you do not go you will not understand them online. read your book. test are hard. labs are sooooo stupid, but you must do them because questions for them will be on the test. oh yeah most of the time she talks about her life.

Definitely use your book. This will probably be your only reliable resource for this class. If you like science and can listen, go to every single class and make sure to listen and write what she says because she skims and her PowerPoints are not descriptive at all. Do the labs because they are 75% of the test questions.

EASY. The reason people fail this class is because they don't open the book... Granted, the professor's position in class is pointless. If you can't read and learn for yourself don't take the class, but if you like independent study it's PERFECT. Tons of extra credit. Final optional, drops lowest grade.

Not as bad as these reviews made it sound. 5 extra credit opportunities, each for 10 points. Final grade is out of 800 points. 4 tests & cumulative final. Drops lowest grade. Test questions were okay, nothing too in depth. Lectures were boring & not helpful. If you read the text and the labs, you will do fine. My best tip:STUDY, and do the ex credi

This class was extremely boring, there is extra credit for every test so that is nice but she never seems knowledgeable about the topic unless it's aquaculture so it is all info from the book. Boredom abounds...

She understands science well, but cannot answer any questions.She CONSTANTLY rambles.Beware of hearing the word "um" 8 times per minute.Can be bipolar:Mostly she's sweet but will randomly yell at you on test days. Her tests are AWFUL with difficult questions about the most random info. Don't take this class.

Wow. Even 1.5 years after I took her class, I can say with substance that she is easily the worst teacher I have had at KSU thus far. Everything I learned, I learned independently. The majority of my class had Ds and Fs. I managed to get a B, but it was hard work. I would definitely not suggest for anyone to take her!

This material was actually quite interesting.. if you could comprehend it. The professor is passionate about aquaculture.. & that's it. She doesn't really know much past that. Her classes are boring, but slightly helpful. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this course to anyone though.

This is a typical auditorium lecture class. The SI sessions helped. It was still hard. I actually tried and studied all semester and made a C. Tests were very confusing. She's a nice lady and passionate about science, but not very good at explaining material. You have to pretty much teach yourself.

She is extremely difficult, hard to understand, confusing, etc.  I am a good student and I had no idea what she was rambling about.  She can be rude and gets mad easily.  Her tests are really hard--not sure if she could pass them herself.  I got a B in the class and was mad because I usually get A's.  The class should not be this ridiculous.

She is a horrible teacher. She could not answer any of the questions that I asked her. She tests you on her personal life and she expects you to know everything. She asks stupid questions and her grading scale is not fair. I advise you not to take her. I took her in Spring 2009 and she is horrible. The board needs to FIRE HER.

You have to read, and study lectures to pass tests. Lab quizzes will kill your grade if you do not do them. Drops lowest test grade. Does not respond to emails, and give very indirect answers to questions in class.

Most comments are correct - she is not a very good teacher, it can be frustrating at times, but on the other hand it is so easy to get an A.  She reviews a lot, almost in every class, so you kind of guess what will be on the test.  There are 4 tests, she drops the lowest grade.  Test and quiz (for lab) questions are multiple choice, you have to stu

While she is very knowledgable about Science, she does not convey it to her class. If you ask her to elaborate, she cant! If you email her a question, dont expect it to be answered. READ the book and along with her powerpoints, you might be ok.

While this woman seems very nice and a wonderful science lover she is a TERRIBLE teacher. SHe reads from preprepared power point and doesn't really expand on much. PLus the class is not mandatory which made me skip alot because it was painful to attend. I fell asleep 2wice in class which I have never done. I meant to take the other McElroy...;(

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS! This professor is unable to explain anything she teaches with precise, affirmative answers. She reads from prepared notes in a soft timid voice to a class of 200 students. She may have a masters in science but is unable to teach what she has learned. Waste of money, she should not be teaching.

soft spoken, somewhat timid for such a big class size. You watch lots of videos and answer questions about them (that don't get graded). I got an A, but i'm not sure how because I didn't buy the book or study until the night before. Just take notes on her Powerpoints and you'll prob be surprised w/how well you do =)

She does not need to be teaching lower division classes! Class size was way too large for the amount of extra help needed by students to understand what she wanted out of us. Loves science,and seems to have it in her head that everyone in her class is a science major. I would not suggest taking her class for lower division science
